snippet: Investors have concluded that the rescue could be a better deal for the banks and their shareholders than for the government, taxpayers and bondholders.
abstract: News analysis; investors seem to have concluded that the $125 billion bailout for Spain's banks could be a better deal for the banks and their shareholders than for the country, its government, taxpayers and bondholders; Madrid will ultimately be responsible for guaranteeing the money, adding to the Spanish government's already rising debt; burden will ultimately fall on the Spanish people.
lead_paragraph: Investors have concluded that the rescue could be a better deal for the banks and their shareholders than for the government, taxpayers and bondholders.

headline.seo: Bailout in Spain Leaves Taxpayers Liable for the Cost
headline.main: Bailout in Spain Leaves Taxpayers Liable for the Cost
headline.print_headline: Downside Of a Bailout In Spain
